general: This act helps simplify the legal system by removing laws that are no longer useful or practical. It makes it easier for people to understand and follow the law by getting rid of outdated rules and regulations. This can help reduce confusion and make the legal system more efficient.

series.short: "Repealing Certain Enactments and Amending Consequential Provisions"
series.text:
* Simplified point 1: Repeals certain enactments specified in Schedule 1 to the extent specified in the second column of that Schedule.
* Simplified point 2: Provides for consequential and connected provisions in Schedule 2.
* Simplified point 3: Extends to the whole of the United Kingdom and the Isle of Man, with some exceptions.
* Simplified point 4: Allows for the extension of repeals and amendments to the Channel Islands and British overseas territories through Order in Council.
* Simplified point 5: Does not repeal or amend any enactment forming part of the law of a country outside the United Kingdom and the Isle of Man.

summary: The Statute Law (Repeals) Act 2008 simplifies and modernizes outdated laws in the United Kingdom and the Isle of Man. It gets rid of old laws that are no longer useful, making it easier for everyone to understand and follow the rules. This act applies to the entire UK and the Isle of Man, except for some specific cases. The government can also extend these changes to other places like the Channel Islands and British overseas territories if they want to. This act doesn't change any laws that are important to countries outside the UK and the Isle of Man.
single:
• The Statute Law (Repeals) Act 2008 aims to simplify and modernize the statute law by repealing certain enactments that are no longer practical or useful.
• The Act repeals specific enactments listed in Schedule 1, which are primarily from the 19th and early 20th centuries.
• The repeals do not affect any existing rights or liabilities, and any remaining provisions of the repealed enactments will continue to apply as if the Act had not been passed.
• The Act extends to the whole of the United Kingdom and the Isle of Man, with some exceptions for the Channel Islands and British overseas territories.
• The repeals and amendments in Schedules 1 and 2 have the same extent as the enactments repealed or amended, unless specified otherwise.
• The Act does not repeal or amend any enactment that forms part of the law of a country outside the United Kingdom and the Isle of Man.
• The Act may be cited as the Statute Law (Repeals) Act 2008.
